title: Chapter 13 â€“ Practice: Functions, Parameters, and Return Values
description: Hands-on missions for chapter 13 defining and calling functions, using parameters (including defaults), and returning values.

solution.notes: Learner should define a function greet(name) that prints a greeting including the name, and call it at least twice with different names.
Learner should define add(a, b) that returns a + b using return, store the result in a variable, and print it.
Learner should define greet(name, greeting='Hello') and call it both with one argument and with two arguments to show the default in action.
Learner should define rectangle_area(width, height) that returns width * height, call it for at least two rectangles, and print or compare the results.
